â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•—
â•‘          DataPilot CLI              â•‘
â•‘    Simple & LLM-Ready Analysis      â•‘
â•‘         Version 1.1.1             â•‘
â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

Usage: datapilot [options] [command]

CSV analysis tool optimized for LLM consumption

Options:
  -V, --version         output the version number
  -h, --help            display help for command

Commands:
  all [options] <file>  Run complete analysis suite - all commands in one go
  eda [options] <file>  Exploratory Data Analysis - comprehensive statistical
                        analysis
  int [options] <file>  Data Integrity Check - find quality issues and
                        inconsistencies
  vis [options] <file>  Visualization Recommendations - what charts would be
                        most insightful
  eng [options] [file]  Data Engineering Archaeology - builds collective
                        intelligence about your warehouse
  llm [options] <file>  LLM Context Generation - perfect summary for AI
                        analysis
  ui                    ğŸ¨ Interactive UI - Fun, colorful, beginner-friendly
                        interface
  help [command]        display help for command

Examples:
  $ datapilot all data.csv                    # Run complete analysis
  $ datapilot all "C:\My Data\sales.csv"      # Path with spaces (use quotes)
  $ datapilot all data.csv -o analysis.txt    # Save to file
  $ datapilot all data.csv --quick            # Quick mode
  $ datapilot eda sales.csv --encoding latin1 # Force encoding
  $ datapilot int data.csv --delimiter ";"    # Force delimiter

Data Archaeology Workflow:
  1. Analyze all tables: datapilot eng analyze *.csv
  2. Copy LLM prompts and get insights from your AI
  3. Save insights: datapilot eng save <table> "<insights>"
  4. Generate report: datapilot eng report

Common Options:
  -o, --output <path>      Save analysis to file
  -q, --quick              Quick mode - skip detailed analyses
  --no-header              CSV has no header row
  --encoding <type>        Force encoding (utf8, latin1, utf16le)
  --delimiter <char>       Force delimiter (comma, semicolon, tab, pipe)
  --timeout <ms>           Set timeout in milliseconds (default: 30s for EDA, 60s for LLM)
  --force                  Continue analysis despite data quality warnings
  --comprehensive          Use comprehensive analysis for LLM mode (default: true)

Troubleshooting:
  â€¢ For paths with spaces, use quotes: "C:\My Folder\data.csv"
  â€¢ For encoding issues, try: --encoding latin1
  â€¢ For delimiter issues, try: --delimiter ";"
  â€¢ For large files, quick mode is recommended: --quick
  â€¢ If analysis hangs, try: --timeout 120000 (2 minutes)
  â€¢ For data quality issues, try: --force

Output:
  All commands produce verbose text output optimized for
  copying into ChatGPT, Claude, or any other LLM.
